post.body: No, that one's new to me!
i wish I had that problem.
No, that's affordable. Gs are extremely common. Now, if the premiums called for 8 Js or Qs a year, you'd have a point.
It's good!
Your face is a number.
Good stuff! Now add an image for your Twitter-self.
I'm saying it a bit early 'cuz I'm tired: Happy New Year, folks!
So I just watched a compilation of 2008's viral videos - first time I saw that Saxby ad and that is FUCKED. UP.
I have at least two comic books coming out this year that I did the art for: Liquid Revolver (small press) and Trickster (Fulcrum Press).
They are the cheapest (most likely) but they RAISE your premiums every year, even if you have a perfect driving record. Bullshit.
Geico's constant ads made me curious - are they the cheapest for auto insurance, and if so, how? Answers: Yes, BUT...
This Doctor Horrible's Sing-Along Blog DVD has some fun extras.
I like io9's compilation of 2008's best tv moments: http://tinyurl.com/748lk4
Oh man, just 90 years and a day until Ravage 2099 is a reality!
Dear Michael Cera: You are funny, but you play George Michael Bluth all the time, so please stop delaying the Arrested Development film.
If Mountain Dew ever wants to sponsor anything I do, I will promote that stuff like a modern day promotey-guy. I already wear Dew gear.
Going to my stepbrother's wedding tomorrow. Since Krissy's out of town, a small wedding with a Morton's steak dinner ain't too shabby.
Remember to lock it. http://tinyurl.com/2bh36a
LL Smooth B? http://tehjacon.livejournal.com/75561.html
I've figured out the formula for whether your movie will bomb: if Wendy's sells toys based on it, you'll fail.
